title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
12:17 <jstoldt> XW-839  
12:17 <jstoldt> whoops  
12:17 <jstoldt> XE-839  
12:17 <vmassol> thanks  
12:17 <jstoldt> you're welcome  
12:18 <vmassol> going for lunch  
12:18 <jstoldt> bon appeteite  
12:18 <jstoldt> \*appetite...  
12:18 <vmassol> appetit :)  
12:18 <jstoldt> wow, my french sucks worse by the second...  
12:18 <jstoldt> hahahaha  
12:18 <vmassol> appétit to be correct  
12:18 <jstoldt> it's been too long... over 6 years since i couldn't speak it in school  
12:18 <jstoldt> :-D  
12:33 <jstoldt> XWIKI-6016  
12:40 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
12:41 <jstoldt> something is wrong with the activity stream: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/News  
12:43 <jstoldt> also, jira says that a XWiki Core version 2.6.2 has been released... when, for all i can see, it hasn't been  
12:43 <+tmortagne> jstoldt: that's probably sdumitriu is in the middle of it  
12:44 <+tmortagne> s/probably/probably because/  
12:44 <jstoldt> right and suddenly the activity stream is back to all good, too  
12:54 <abusenius> has quit  
12:57 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
13:04 <vmassol> jstoldt: it's not the AS. It's the old changes page. You got lots of question marks right?  
13:04 <vmassol> I saw that yesterday and the bday before  
13:05 <vmassol> it disappears after some time and comes back, it's strange I don't know what's happening  
13:05 <jstoldt> i did at first  
13:05 <jstoldt> \*it did at first  
13:05 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:05 <jstoldt> also, all links were leading to /bin/create  
13:22 <jstoldt> is there a test that checks all possible parameters that can be applied to images?  
13:23 <jstoldt> as of now i know about width, height, title, alt, keepAspectRatio and quality  
13:23 <vmassol> jstoldt: no test  
13:24 <jstoldt> okay, any other source code file that could give me more detailed leads on this?  
13:25 <jstoldt> also, what i wondered about, when we use a url address for the image, will we still be able to use quality?  
13:28 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
13:35 <jstoldt> hmmm vmassol, i just realized that i prolly forgot a small thing for the 2.0 and 2.1 link syntax... right now i don't specify that the label might just as well be an image... should i add that to my patch on XE-839?  
13:36 <jstoldt> although it's already displayed in the table...  
13:38 <vmassol> jstoldt: I think we said it can contain any wiki syntax, didn't we?  
13:38 <jstoldt> yes we did. you are right then  
13:38 <jstoldt> my bad :)  
13:40 <@sdumitriu> jstoldt: 2.6.2 is half-released  
13:40 <jstoldt> ah, i see, sdumitriu  
13:40 <jstoldt> are you doing 2.7.1 soon, too?  
13:40 <@sdumitriu> The maven build and the SVN tags are done  
13:40 <jstoldt> i see  
13:40 <+tmortagne> vmassol: i think there was another issue like XWIKI-6017  
13:41 <@sdumitriu> Waiting for people to test the artifacts before publishing them further  
13:41 <@sdumitriu> I sent an email last night about this  
13:41 <@sdumitriu> 2.7.1 will be Monday or very soon after  
13:41 <vmassol> tmortagne: maybe, if you can find the link let me know  
13:41 <jstoldt> oh, didn't read the mail, tbh. next week sounds great :)  
13:42 <jstoldt> will 2.7.1 have the fixed forgotPassword fixed?  
13:42 <jstoldt> i could also provide you my files/ a patch for that, if you want me to  
13:43 <jstoldt> those would at least restore functionality, although they aren't particulary beautiful ;)  
13:43 <+tmortagne> vmassol: can't find it, probably was just a talk  
13:44 <vmassol> k  
13:47 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: re XWIKI-6003 I'd rather fire a xwiki:fullscreen:enter event (paired with the existing xwiki:fullscreen:entered ) and a xwiki:fullscreen:exit event (paired with xwiki:fullscreen:exited) , WDYT?  
13:47 <+mflorea> and have my code in XWikiWysiwyg.js  
13:48 <+mflorea> i.e. save the selection enter/exit and restore it on entered/exited  
13:49 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
13:50 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: +1  
13:50 <+mflorea> good  
14:19 <sdumitriu> has quit  
15:03 <+tmortagne> some core test are failing, see http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-core/com.xpn.xwiki.platform$xwiki-core/6905/testReport/  
15:03 <vmassol> hmm probably caused by my changes of earlier this week  
15:03 <vmassol> checking  
15:14 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:14 <jstoldt> yeah, finally got the server  
15:17 <vmassol> tmortagne: test fixed, hope it was the only one  
15:22 <+tmortagne> vmassol: ok  
15:23 <vmassol> ok looking at including sections now  
15:23 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'm not extra happy about my "hack" for passing base references to WikiModel impl…. but I couldn't find a better solution  
15:24 <+tmortagne> did not looked yet  
15:24 <vmassol> while you were away I sneaked a baseReference field in ResourceReference  
15:24 <vmassol> and now I've just modified it to be a List  
15:26 <+tmortagne> ok  
15:28 <+tmortagne> it's a List to make easier to convert to EntityReference ?  
15:28 <vmassol> yes  
15:28 <vmassol> to resolve the reference in XWikiWikiModel  
15:28 <+tmortagne> ok  
15:29 <vmassol> the other solution would have been to add a new method param in WikiModel calls  
15:29 <vmassol> s/calls/methods/  
15:32 <+tmortagne> needs to check the whole thing, don't understand exactly what is basereference  
15:33 <vmassol> it's just the storage of MetaData SOURCE values  
15:33 <+tmortagne> ok i see  
15:34 <+tmortagne> indeed it's not very clean that way  
15:34 <vmassol> since we want to manipulate only strings in rendering-api  
15:34 <vmassol> these strings have to be resolved in XWikiWikiModel  
15:34 <vmassol> so we need to pass the info to XWikiWikiModel somehow  
15:34 <+tmortagne> i think i would have prefered a new parameter in WikiModel  
15:35 <vmassol> I hesitated and I found it not that bad to actually have that info inside the ResourceReference (that allowed me not to break the api too) but that wasn't my main motivation)  
15:43 <vmassol> tmortagne: wdyt about adding a getXDOM() to DocumentModelBridge and modifying IncludeMacro to use getXDOM() instead of getContent() ?  
15:44 <+tmortagne> make sense yes since includemacro does not really care how the content is really stored  
15:45 <vmassol> that'll help me too for include section  
15:45 <+tmortagne> indeed  
15:45 <vmassol> btw I need your api to look for a section with a given id easily ;)  
15:46 <+tmortagne> talk with checkstyle ;)  
15:46 <vmassol> hehe  
15:48 <+tmortagne> switch/case and cyclomatic complexity check is a explosive combo  
15:48 <vmassol> yep but switch/case is usually a bit of an antipattern  
15:49 <+tmortagne> well it's quick :)  
15:49 <vmassol> (not extensible)  
15:49 <vmassol> yep  
16:04 <vmassol> … I need to clone the XDOM ….  
16:04 <vmassol> (when there's a tx)  
16:05 <vmassol> (the alternative is to always clone in getXDOM() - safer but less performant)  
16:09 <abusenius> has quit  
16:21 <+tmortagne> finally ! in your face checkstyle  
16:24 <vmassol> hehe nice!  
16:24 <+tmortagne> committed  
16:38 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
16:52 <jstoldt> mflorea:  
16:52 <jstoldt> could you help me a bit?  
16:52 <jstoldt> got problems with the Office Server  
16:53 <jstoldt> http://paste.codebasehq.com/pastes/328  
16:54 <jstoldt> i copied the user directories from my other installation  
16:54 <jstoldt> and changed the settings alright  
16:54 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
16:54 <jstoldt> but i can't figure out why it won't start  
16:55 <jstoldt> only real difference is that i am now using tomcat with MSSQL instead of postgreSQL  
17:05 <+mflorea> jstoldt: try to kill the office server and make sure there is not other service running on port 8100 then try again. It doesn't seem to be a problem with XWiki:  
17:05 <+mflorea> Caused by: java.net.ConnectException: connection failed: 'socket,host=127.0.0.1,port=8100,tcpNoDelay=1'; java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect  
17:14 <jstoldt> will try  
17:15 <jstoldt> hmmm no office server running... wtf?!  
17:16 <jstoldt> and netstat doesn't show me any other prog running on 81000  
17:16 <jstoldt> 8100^^  
17:16 <+mflorea> I see, hmm  
17:19 <+mflorea> jstoldt: check the command line conversion tool http://code.google.com/p/jodconverter/wiki/GettingStarted  
17:21 <+mflorea> we're using jodconverter-core-3.0-beta-3.jar (with 2 small patches) so it's good to know if you can reproduce the problem  
17:24 <jstoldt> are you suggesting i use the Command Line thingy? because when i do i get "could not find the main class"  
17:24 <venkatesh> has quit  
17:24 <jstoldt> i used latest 2.7 snapshot...  
17:25 <+mflorea> did you use the correct path to the jodconverted jar?  
17:26 <jstoldt> i auto completed it...  
17:26 <jstoldt> jodconverter-core-3.0-beta-3.20110210.jar  
17:28 <jstoldt> http://paste.codebasehq.com/pastes/329  
17:31 <+mflorea> indeed, I get the same, it means it needs the CommandLineParser in the classpath  
17:32 <jstoldt> huh?  
17:32 <+mflorea> http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/commons-cli/commons-cli/1.2/  
17:32 <+mflorea> let me try  
17:33 <jstoldt> ok  
17:34 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:37 <jstoldt> so?  
17:39 <+mflorea> still trying  
17:40 <vmassol> tmortagne: can I chain block matcher? actually let me read the unit tests  
17:40 <+tmortagne> what do you mean by chain block matcher ?  
17:40 <vmassol> use case: look for all HeaderBlock with a given id  
17:41 <vmassol> so I wanted a ClassBlockMatcher chained with some other matcher to check for the id  
17:41 <vmassol> so that I don't have to do a test on the block instanceof  
17:41 <+tmortagne> ok I did not added a MultiBlockMatcher but basically that's how i see it in this case  
17:42 <+tmortagne> i.e. add a BlockMatcher which takes a list of BlockMatcher (i did not had the use case so it's not here yet but we will probably add lot's of other matchers like that)  
17:43 <vmassol> w ecould also add a constructor for the existing matchers  
17:43 <+tmortagne> compositeBlockMatcher is provbably a better name  
17:43 <vmassol> it depends how verbose we want it  
17:48 <vmassol>         Block headerBlock = includedContent.getFirstBlock(new BlockMatcher() {  
17:55 <vmassol>             public boolean match(Block block)  
17:55 <vmassol>             {  
17:55 <vmassol>                 if (block instanceof HeaderBlock) {  
17:55 <vmassol>                     HeaderBlock headerBlock = (HeaderBlock) block;  
17:55 <vmassol>                     if (headerBlock.getId().equals(parameters.getSection())) {  
18:08 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
18:09 <vmassol>                     }  
18:09 <vmassol>                 }  
18:09 <vmassol>                 return false;  
18:09 <vmassol>             }  
18:09 <vmassol>         }, Block.Axes.DESCENDANT);  
18:09 <vmassol> tmortagne: so that's how I would write it now right?  
18:09 <+tmortagne> you can reduce a bit  
18:09 <+tmortagne> using ClassBlockParser instead of BlockMatcher  
18:09 <+tmortagne> but it does not reduce much either  
18:09 <vmassol> how would I use ClassBlockParser?  
18:09 <vmassol> (in this example)  
18:09 <+tmortagne> you do the same thing you do in your example  
18:09 <vmassol> I cannot do a new on it  
18:09 <vmassol> it's not an interface  
18:09 <+tmortagne> except that you just call super.match instead of block instanceof HeaderBlock  
18:09 <+tmortagne> so it does not reduce much as you can see, it's just a bit more logical  
18:09 <+tmortagne> yes you can  
18:09 <+tmortagne> you can do it on anything  
18:09 <+tmortagne> (AFAIK)  
18:09 <vmassol> anyway since I need to call super it doesn't help much indeed  
18:09 <vmassol> tmortagne: can the user give an explicit id to a section?  
18:10 <vmassol> (i don't recall)  
18:10 <+tmortagne> not sure, i would say no but i need to check  
18:10 <+tmortagne> he can put an id macro in front of it which is pretty much the same thing from browser POV  
18:10 <vmassol> because right now users need to know how to compute the id to use it in the  include macro  
18:11 <vmassol> yes but not for my use case  
18:11 <vmassol> which is {{include document="…" section="id here"/}}  
18:11 <+tmortagne> indeed  
18:11 <+tmortagne> let me check  
18:11 <vmassol> it works btw, I just need to clean and commit  
18:11 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
18:12 <mflorea> has quit  
18:12 <abusenius> has quit

18:12 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
18:13 <+mflorea> jstoldt: did you receive my message?  
18:13 <+mflorea> java -cp "jodconverter-core-3.0-beta-3.20110210.jar:commons-cli-1.2.jar:commons-io-2.0.jar:juh-3.1.0.jar:jurt-3.1.0.jar:org.json-2.0.jar:ridl-3.1.0.jar:unoil-3.1.0.jar" -Doffice.home=/usr/lib/openoffice/ org.artofsolving.jodconverter.cli.Convert test.odt test.pdf  
18:13 <+mflorea> Note that you have to copy the http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/commons-cli/commons-cli/1.2/ jar to WEB-INF/lib and run from there. Also, adjust the versions of jars because I tested on a XE 3.0 snapshot  
18:13 <jstoldt> will try  
18:14 <+mflorea> also adjust the office.home

18:15 <+tmortagne> problem is that there is no shuch thing as id header id in Wiki Model API  
18:15 <+tmortagne> but we could define a parameter
